verses.roman:
yāiteha patha nāhi, yāibe kemane?
mahā-aparādha haya prabhura laṅghane

synonyms: yāiteha—to go; patha nāhi—there was no passage; yāibe kemane—how would he go away; mahā-aparādha—a great offense; haya—there would be; prabhura laṅghane—to cross over the body of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
translation: There was no way to go. How could he leave? When he thought of crossing over the Lord's body, he considered it a great offense.
